code: @Manual{,   title = {gms: 'GAMS' Modularization Support Package},   author = {Jan Philipp Dietrich and David Klein and Anastasis Giannousakis and Felicitas Beier and Johannes Koch and Lavinia Baumstark and Mika Pflüger and Oliver Richters},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.33.6}, }

title: GAMS Modularization Support Package
text: R package gms, version 0.33.6

title: GAMS Modularization Support Package
text: collection tools create, use maintain modularized model code written modeling language ‘GAMS’ (https://www.gams.com/). ---box ‘GAMS’ come support modularized model code. package provides tools necessary convert standard ‘GAMS’ model modularized one introducing modularized code structure together naming convention emulates local environments. addition, package provides tools monitor compliance model code modular coding guidelines.

title: GAMS Modularization Support Package
text: installation recent package version additional repository added R: additional repository can made available permanently adding line file called .Rprofile stored home folder system (Sys.glob("~") R returns home directory). recent version package can installed using install.packages: Package updates can installed using update.packages (make sure additional repository added running command):

title: GAMS Modularization Support Package
text: case questions / problems please contact Jan Philipp Dietrich dietrich@pik-potsdam.de.

title: GAMS Modularization Support Package
text: cite package gms publications use: Dietrich J, Klein D, Giannousakis , Beier F, Koch J, Baumstark L, Pflüger M, Richters O (2025). “gms: ‘GAMS’ Modularization Support Package.” doi:10.5281/zenodo.4390032 https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4390032, Version: 0.33.6, https://github.com/pik-piam/gms. title: checkAppearance — checkAppearance
text: list four elements: appearance, setappearance, type warnings. Appearance matrix containing values indicate whether object appears part code (e.g. indicates whether "vm_example" appears realization "" module "test" .). 0 means appear, 1 means appears code 2 means appears not_used.txt. setappearance contains information sets instead objects. Type vector containing type object (exluding sets). warnings contains list warnings created process.

title: chooseFromList — chooseFromList
text: theList list character vector selected , names can specify groups type string plural shown user understand choose userinfo string printed user choosing addAllPattern boolean whether '' 'Search pattern' options added returnBoolean TRUE: returns array dimension theList FALSE TRUE, erases order entries selected FALSE: returns selected entries theList, conserving order entries selected multiple TRUE: allows select multiple entries. FALSE: userinput string provided user. supplied, user asked (mainly testing) errormessage string used internally tell user retrying selection make sense

title: codeCheck — codeCheck
text: Checks GAMS code consistency. Throws warnings something wrong code returns list containing interfaces module code.

title: codeCheck — codeCheck
code: codeCheck(   path = ".",   modulepath = "modules",   core_files = c("core/*.gms", "main.gms"),   returnDebug = FALSE,   interactive = FALSE,   test_switches = TRUE,   strict = FALSE,   details = FALSE )

title: codeCheck — codeCheck
text: path path main folder model modulepath path module folder relative "path" core_files list files belong core (wildcard expansion supported) returnDebug TRUE additional information returned useful debugging codeCheck function interactive activates interactive developer mode warnings can fixed interactively. test_switches (boolean) realization switches model core tested completeness? Usually set TRUE set FALSE standalone models using subset existing modules strict (boolean) test strictness. set TRUE warnings codeCheck stop calculations end analysis. Useful enforce clean code. details (boolean) activated function return detailed output. Besides interface information provide table containing declarations code, appearance table listing appearance objects code information existing modules. format list(interfaceInfo,declarations,appearance,modulesInfo). setting ignored returnDebug set TRUE.

title: codeCheck — codeCheck
text: list modules containing interfaces module. detailed output either details returnDebug set TRUE.

title: codeCheck — codeCheck
text: Additional settings can provided via yaml file ".codeCheck" main folder model. Currently supported settings : - capitalExclusionList: list names ignored checking unified capitalization variables

title: codeCheck — codeCheck
text: Jan Philipp Dietrich

title: codeCheck — codeCheck
code: # check code consistency of dummy model codeCheck(system.file("dummymodel", package = "gms")) #>  #>  Running codeCheck... #>  Finished data collection...            (time elapsed:  0.034) #>  Naming conventions check done...       (time elapsed:  0.034) #>   Running checkAppearance... #>   Start variable matching...            (time elapsed:  0.001) #>   Finished variable matching...         (time elapsed:  0.001) #>   Start var capitalization check...     (time elapsed:  0.002) #>   Finished var capitalization check...  (time elapsed:  0.003) #>  Investigated variable appearances...   (time elapsed:  0.038) #>  Appearance and usage check done...     (time elapsed:  0.039) #>  Switch Appearance check done...        (time elapsed:   0.04) #>  Interface collection and check done... (time elapsed:  0.041) #>  Input folder check done...             (time elapsed:  0.041) #>  Description check done...              (time elapsed:  0.042) #>  All codeCheck tests passed! #> $core #>         out  #> "pm_global"  #>  #> $fancymodule #>            in           out  #>   "pm_global" "vm_exchange"  #>  #> $crazymodule #>            in  #> "vm_exchange"  #>

title: Download and unpack compressed data from repositories — download_distribute
code: download_distribute(   files,   repositories = list(`/p/projects/rd3mod/inputdata/output` = NULL),   modelfolder = ".",   additionalDelete = NULL,   debug = FALSE,   stopOnMissing = FALSE )

title: Download and unpack compressed data from repositories — download_distribute
text: files vector files containing input data, file .tgz downloaded unpacked repositories list repositories (please pay attention list format!) files searched . Files searched repositories found, always starting first repository list. argument must format named list url repository name corresponding list options username password access repository value. options required value NULL. (e.g. list("ftp://my_pw_protected_server.de/data"=list(user="",password=12345), "http://free_server.de/dat"=NULL)) modelfolder main model folder additionalDelete information additional data deleted new data downloaded distributed debug switch debug mode additional diagnostic information stopOnMissing Boolean passed along download_unpack() stop file files downloaded.  (FALSE) default.

title: Download and unpack compressed data from repositories — download_distribute
text: Information download process form data.frame data sets row names repositories (downloaded ) corresponding md5sum columns

title: Download and unpack compressed data from repositories — download_distribute

title: Download and unpack compressed data from repositories — download_unpack
text: input vector files downloaded cfg list settings used (e.g. containing cfg$input, cfg$repositories). Settings config list overwritten arguments function set NULL targetdir directory files downloaded extracted repositories list repositories (please pay attention list format!) files searched . Files searched repositories found, always starting first repository list. argument must format named list url repository name corresponding list options username password access repository value. options required value NULL. (e.g. list("ftp://my_pw_protected_server.de/data"=list(user="",password=12345), "http://free_server.de/dat"=NULL)) debug switch debug mode additional diagnostic information unpack switched source files purley downloaded stopOnMissing Boolean indicating whether stop file files downloaded. (FALSE) default. Can either defined single boolean, applies equally elements files, can defined individually element files.

title: fulldataOutput — fulldataOutput
text: Creates GAMS code stores automatically levels, bounds marginals equations variables time depending parameters.

title: fulldataOutput — fulldataOutput
code: fulldataOutput(   declarations_file = "declarations.gms",   definitions_file = "postsolve.gms",   warn = TRUE,   types = c("level", "marginal"),   ignore = "_dummy$",   loopset = "t" )

title: fulldataOutput — fulldataOutput
text: declarations_file GAMS file containing declarations. function read declarations add declarations R environment used replace_in_file (used subject = OUTPUT DECLARATIONS) definitions_file GAMS file executed solve statement within time step loop. Also code added using replace_in_file subject OUTPUT DEFINITIONS warn Decides whether warning thrown , declarations file exist. types Types outputs written gdx file. Available types level, marginal, upper lower. ignore regular expression pattern variables/equations ignored fulldataOutput loopset Set loop runs

title: fulldataOutput — fulldataOutput
text: Jan Philipp Dietrich, Felicitas Beier

title: gms: 'GAMS' Modularization Support Package — gms-package
text: Maintainer: Jan Philipp Dietrich dietrich@pik-potsdam.de (ORCID) (Potsdam Institute Climate Impact Research) Authors: David Klein (Potsdam Institute Climate Impact Research) Anastasis Giannousakis Felicitas Beier (Potsdam Institute Climate Impact Research) Johannes Koch (Potsdam Institute Climate Impact Research) Lavinia Baumstark (Potsdam Institute Climate Impact Research) Mika Pflüger Oliver Richters (Potsdam Institute Climate Impact Research)

title: interfaceplot — interfaceplot
text: Creates interface plot modular model using qgraph returns interface information.

title: interfaceplot — interfaceplot
code: interfaceplot(   x = ".",   modules_to_include = NULL,   modules_to_exclude = NULL,   links_to_include = NULL,   links_to_exclude = NULL,   items_to_include = NULL,   items_to_exclude = NULL,   items_to_display = NULL,   default_groups = list(default1 = list(name = "core", nodes = "core", color = "black",     shape = "rectangle"), default2 = list(name = "modules", nodes = NULL, color =     "#6c9ebf", shape = "ellipse")),   highlight_groups = NULL,   max_length_node_names = NULL,   add_nodeName_legend = FALSE,   max_num_edge_labels = NULL,   max_num_nodes_for_edge_labels = 30,   ... )

title: interfaceplot — interfaceplot
text: x Either interface list returned codeCheck path main folder model. modules_to_include NULL (default value) vector strings names modules include, e.g. c("core", "macro"). NULL modules included. modules_to_exclude NULL (default value) vector strings names modules exclude, e.g. c("core"). NULL modules excluded. links_to_include NULL (default value) list lists attributes "" "", take vector module names, e.g. list(list(="macro", ="core")). NULL links included. links_to_exclude NULL (default value) list lists attributes "" "", take vector module names, e.g. list(list(="macro", ="core")). NULL links excluded. items_to_include NULL (default value) vector strings names items include, e.g. c("vm_cesIO", "pm_pvp"). Regex patterns can also passed, e.g. c("(v|p)m_.*"). NULL items included. items_to_exclude NULL (default value) vector strings names items exclude, e.g. c("vm_cesIO", "pm_pvp"). Regex patterns can also passed, e.g. c("sm_.*"). NULL items excluded. items_to_display NULL (default value) vector strings names items display, e.g. c("vm_cesIO", "pm_pvp"). Regex patterns can also passed, e.g. c(.m\ S+). NULL items displayed. default_groups List lists default group definitions. Defines default formatting interface plot. default, two groups, see usage, "core" group made "core" module "modules" group made rest. "core" module exist, group simply ignored. highlight_groups NULL (default value) list lists highlight-group definitions. defining highligh groups, additional/specalized formatting can applied select modules. group defined list following attributes: name: string group name. appear legend. nodes: vector strings module names. shape: string valid qgraph shape. color: string valid qgraph color. edges_to_highlight: "" = edges starting ending highlight group's nodes colored "incoming" = edges ending highlight group's nodes colored "outgoing" = edges starting highlight group's nodes colored "within" = edges departed highlight group's nodes end well colored edges_to_ignore: "outside" edges neither start end group's nodes ignored "incoming" edges depart one group's nodes ignored "outgoing" edges arrive one group's nodes ignored "outgoing_to_no_return" edges departing nodes outside group ending nodes within group ignored example: list(list(name = "highlight", nodes = "welfare", color = "#ff8f00", shape = "ellipse", edges_to_highlight = "outgoing", edges_to_ignore = "outside")). max_length_node_names NULL (default value) integer n giving maximum number characters allowed node names. NULL, node names truncated n characters, e.g. n=3: "example" -> "exa.". add_nodeName_legend Logical (default FALSE) add node names legend, structured group. max_num_edge_labels NULL (default value), integer string "adjust". NULL, edge lables displayed. given integer n, maximum n edge labels shown.  set "adjust", number edge labels displayed decreases number nodes. max_num_nodes_for_edge_labels Integer, (default value = 30). maximum number nodes edge labels displayed. ... Optional arguments qgraph.

title: interfaceplot — interfaceplot
text: tibble edge list interface items.

title: interfaceplot — interfaceplot
text: modules (=nodes), links (=edges) items (=passed along edges) taken account creating plot can fine-tuned "_include", "_exclude" arguments. "default"- "highlight_groups" arguments control formatting (also composition "highlight_group$edges_to_ignore"). Groups qqgraph way clustering nodes together. default formatting plot defined "default_groups" argument. top additional groups can defined "highlight_groups" argument. rest arguments pretty self-explanatory. Just remember qgraph arguments can passed well! Useful ones include: fade=T/F, legend=T/F, legend.cex (size legend font), GLratio (graph/legend size ratio, edge.label.cex (size edge label font)).

title: interfaceplot — interfaceplot
text: Johannes Koch

title: Model lock/unlock — model_lock
text: Lock model coordinate multiple processes accessing model. necessary change files within model avoid another process reads half-written changes mean time. model_lock creates exclusive lock given file returns lock id. lock id handed model_unlock lock dropped , another process can take lock. lock also dropped lock id goes scope garbage collected R R process terminates crashes. However, good practice explicitly call model_unlock need lock anymore. want check informational purposes model currently locked another process, can use is_model_locked() function. Note however never use is_model_locked() coordinate access model folder. return value is_model_locked() snapshot time function run. Note additionally is_model_locked() checks model locked another process. currently hold lock model , return FALSE.

title: Model lock/unlock — model_lock
code: model_lock(folder = ".", file = ".lock", timeout1 = 12, timeout2 = NULL, check_interval = NULL, oncluster = NULL) model_unlock(id, folder = NULL, file = NULL, oncluster = NULL) is_model_locked(folder = ".", file = ".lock")

title: Model lock/unlock — model_lock
text: folder path model folder file file name lock file. use lock file anything else (.e. read write open lock file). timeout1 Time hours wait processes free lock giving exiting error. timeout2 deprecated setting ignored. check_interval deprecated setting ignored. oncluster deprecated setting ignored. id lock id returned model_lock.

title: Model lock/unlock — model_lock
text: model_lock returns lock id needed identify lock model_unlock.

title: Model lock/unlock — model_lock
text: Jan Philipp Dietrich, David Klein, Mika Pflüger

title: Model lock/unlock — model_lock
code: #lock folder id <- model_lock(tempdir()) #> 2026-01-13 09:14:42: try to acquire model lock... #> 2026-01-13 09:14:42: acquired model lock in 0 secs.  #unlock folder model_unlock(id) #> 2026-01-13 09:14:42: unlocked model.

title: Create a Module skeleton — module.skeleton
text: function creates module skeleton can use easily create modules.

title: Create a Module skeleton — module.skeleton
code: module.skeleton(   number,   name,   types,   modelpath = ".",   modulepath = "modules/",   includefile = "modules/include.gms",   version = is.modularGAMS(modelpath, version = TRUE) )

title: Create a Module skeleton — module.skeleton
text: number Number module, typically something 0-99. Sorts execution modules. Please use number used, yet. name Name module (please choose short name). want extend existing module (add new realisation) use name existing one. types Vector names different module types (e.g. "" ""). want extend existing module (add new realisation), put additional type(s) modelpath Path MAgPIE version updated (main folder). modulepath Module path within MAgPIE (relative MAgPIE main folder) includefile Name location file includes modules (relative main folder) version version modular GAMS code structure (1 2)

title: Create a Module skeleton — module.skeleton
text: Module phases automatically detected checking main code model, checking code modules. want use additional phases included within module, need specify manually adding comment gams code indicating additional phase. syntax "* !add_phase!: <phase>", e.g. "* !add_phase!: new_phase"

title: Create a Module skeleton — module.skeleton
text: Jan Philipp Dietrich

title: Create a Module skeleton — module.skeleton
code: # copy dummymodel to temporary directory and add new module "bla" file.copy(system.file("dummymodel",package="gms"),tempdir(), recursive = TRUE) #> [1] TRUE model   <- paste0(tempdir(),"/dummymodel") module.skeleton(number="03", name="bla", types=c("on","off"), modelpath=model)

title: Replace in File — replace_in_file
text: Function replace marked paragaph text file. Paragraph marked text file initial "##### R SECTION START (SUBJECT) #####" "##### R SECTION END (SUBJECT) #####" ending. number # symbols can chosen user, least one beginning one end. Furthermore allowed add symbols beginning end line. "SUBJECT" chosen user used identification, text file one R section.

title: Replace in File — replace_in_file
code: replace_in_file(   file,   content,   subject = "CODE",   add = FALSE,   addfile = FALSE,   comment = "*" )

title: Replace in File — replace_in_file
text: file connection object character string describing file, manipulated. content content used replacement stored vector strings. vector component written line. subject string used identification paragraph. add Determines behavior marking missing code. add=FALSE throw error, marking missing, add="top" add markings automatically beginning file, add="bottom" add=TRUE end file. addfile Determines behavior file exist. addfile=TRUE, file created missing. comment Symbol used indicate comment language file written manipulated. relevant add addfile used.

title: Replace in File — replace_in_file
text: Jan Philipp Dietrich

code:
cfg <- list(input = c(data1 = "blub.tgz", data2 = "bla.tgz"), mode = "default") saveConfig(cfg) #> [1] "input: !<namedVector>
  data1: blub.tgz
  data2: bla.tgz
mode: default
"

what: Merge GAMS code into single file — singleGAMSfile
title: Merge GAMS code into single file — singleGAMSfile
text: function merges GAMS code distributed severals files single GAMS file. Optionally, also embeds R scripts single GAMS file

title: Merge GAMS code into single file — singleGAMSfile
code: singleGAMSfile(   modelpath = ".",   mainfile = "main.gms",   output = "full.gms",   embedRScripts = FALSE )

title: Merge GAMS code into single file — singleGAMSfile
text: modelpath path model stored mainfile path main gams file (relative model path) output Name single output GAMS file. embedRScripts TRUE, R scripts called GAMS via Execute also embedded. Default FALSE

title: Merge GAMS code into single file — singleGAMSfile
text: Jan Philipp Dietrich, Anastasis Giannousakis

title: Merge GAMS code into single file — singleGAMSfile
code: # copy dummymodel create single gms file out of it file.copy(system.file("dummymodel", package = "gms"), tempdir(), recursive = TRUE) #> [1] TRUE model      <- paste0(tempdir(), "/dummymodel") singlefile <- paste0(tempdir(), "/full.gms") singleGAMSfile(modelpath = model, output = singlefile)

what: Create tgz archive from directory — tardir
title: Create tgz archive from directory — tardir
text: Creates tgz files directory

title: Create tgz archive from directory — tardir
Create tgz archive from directory — tardir
text: dir directory tar file generated tarfile name archive data written (tgz file)

title: Create tgz archive from directory — tardir
text: Jan Philipp Dietrich

title: Create tgz archive from directory — tardir
code: # copy dummymodel to temporary directory and compress it file.copy(system.file("dummymodel",package="gms"),tempdir(), recursive = TRUE) #> [1] TRUE model   <- paste0(tempdir(),"/dummymodel") archive <- paste0(tempdir(),"/dummymodel.tgz") tardir(model,archive)

title: Update Modules Embedding in GAMS code — update_modules_embedding
text: modelpath Path model updated (main folder). modulepath Module path within model (relative model main folder) includefile Name location file includes modules (relative main folder) verbose Defines whether additional information printed .

title: Update Modules Embedding in GAMS code — update_modules_embedding
text: Module phases automatically detected checking main code model, checking code modules. want use additional phases included within module, need specify manually adding comment gams code indicating additional phase. syntax "* !add_phase!: <phase>", e.g. "* !add_phase!: new_phase"

title: Update Modules Embedding in GAMS code — update_modules_embedding
text: Jan Philipp Dietrich

title: Update Modules Embedding in GAMS code — update_modules_embedding
code: # copy dummymodel to temporary directory and update module embedding file.copy(system.file("dummymodel", package="gms"), tempdir(), recursive = TRUE) #> [1] TRUE model   <- paste0(tempdir(),"/dummymodel") update_modules_embedding(model)

title: writeSets — writeSets
text: Function write set declaration GAMS syntax given either character vector data.frame (latter represent mapping set)

title: writeSets — writeSets
text: sets list sets every set another list consisting three entries: name (set name character), desc (set description character) items (set elements, either character vector data.frame) file Name file set declarations written . NULL result just returned function. file must exist contain line form "##### R SECTION START (SETS) #####" followed line form ##### R SECTION END (SETS) ##### indicate part file replaced set declaration!

title: writeSets — writeSets
text: set declaration GAMS syntax

title: writeSets — writeSets
text: Jan Philipp Dietrich, Florian Humpenöder

title: writeSets — writeSets
code: countries <- c("DEU", "FRA", "ENG", "ITA", "NLD", "POL") map <- data.frame(region = rep(c("REG1","REG2"), 3), countries = countries) sets <- list(list(name  = "countries",                    desc  = "list of countries",                    items = countries),              list(name = "country2region",                   desc = "mapping between countries and regions",                   items = map))  cat(writeSets(sets), sep="\n") #> * THIS CODE IS CREATED AUTOMATICALLY, DO NOT MODIFY THESE LINES DIRECTLY #> * ANY DIRECT MODIFICATION WILL BE LOST AFTER NEXT AUTOMATIC UPDATE! #>  #> sets #>  #>   countries list of countries #>     / DEU, FRA, ENG, ITA, NLD, POL / #>  #>   country2region mapping between countries and regions #>     / REG1 . (DEU, ENG, NLD) #>       REG2 . (FRA, ITA, POL) / #>  #> ;
